newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page- April 16.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page- April 16.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following stories on its front page on Wednesday:

* The Federal Bureau of Investigation's crime laboratory sometimes used flawed scientific techniques which may have tainted some criminal cases, according to the Justice Department's inspector general.
* Despite a recent Federal rule designed to cut back on such gifts, large bond firms are still contributing heavily to U.S. political campaigns.
* Jackie Robinson, the player who integrated baseball, was honored by a crowd of about 50,000 at New York's Shea Stadium.
* The U.S. government reported consumer prices rose just one-tenth of a percent in March, easing some concerns about inflation.
* A fire at an encampment outside Mecca, Saudi Arabia where two million Moslem pilgrims were gathered, killed as many as 300 people, witnesses said.

* Boots Pharmaceuticals Inc, a forerunner of Knoll Pharmaceutical Co, has allowed publication of a study which showed its thyroid drug Synthroid was not more effective than other cheaper generic versions of the drug.
* The American Heart Association is starting to call for wider availability of defibrillators as cardiologists say portable defibrillators could save lives.
